website_summaries.verdict: A luggage scale that features heavy-duty construction to withstand the test of time and travel.
pros: Includes a digital LCD display with low battery and overload indicators
Boasts tare and auto-off functions to help preserve the scale's battery life
Offers a user-friendly design that ensures you can quickly convert scale readings from kilograms to pounds or pounds to kilograms
cons: Metal triangle that holds the scale's strap tends to bend easily due to heavy luggage

customer_reviews.title: DONT BUY.... Scale shows 0 kgs when i weighed Hand luggage with 7 kgs weight
customer_reviews.text: Scale shows 0 kgs when i weighed Hand luggage of 7 kgs weight . I HAD TO PAY PENALTY ONCE FOR EXTRA LUGGAGE (WEIGED WITH THIS SCALE). Please go ahead and buy if u have to be embarassed in airport for extra luggage and pay penalties. Only worked twice. Please find the videos and pictures
customer_reviews.author: bharat

customer_reviews.title: Originally 5 stars now very disappointed  But rectified quickly and now happy repeat customer
customer_reviews.text: Worked great and was right on the nose compared to the airline scales Update Jan 2018 Loved this product at first but after only a couple of uses it stopped powering on. Changed batteries and still nothing. Very disappointed that this product didn't last longer Update 05/2018 Was very pleased with the customer service response, they replaced the original unit quickly and it works fine. Actually purchased another.
customer_reviews.author: Steve

customer_reviews.title: I think I got a dud.
customer_reviews.text: I think I got a dud. Lots of people seem to like theirs, but mine never gets the same reading twice. When I weighed myself with and without my suitcase to count the difference (the mostly infallible old-school way) I got the same number every time, versus when I used this device three times in a row, I got a different number each time - and I tried this trick with several different objects (suitcases, duffle bags, hand weights, purses, shoes, etc...). This thing just sucks.
customer_reviews.author: Cristina Cuduco

customer_reviews.title: I never write reviews on Amazon but I had to write this.
customer_reviews.text: It stopped worked after weighing just 4 pieces of luggage under 30lbs. This thing is a piece of garbage. In the packaging, you would find a note from the manufacturer offering you freebies if you leave a positive review on Amazon and therefore, I would take most of the 'good' reviews about this product with a grain of salt.
customer_reviews.author: E. Kent

customer_reviews.title: Extremely inaccurate...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for a trip to make sure I wouldn't pay the extra weight fee from the air company. It was in international flight, so I had two suitcases, with a weight limit of 70lbs each. It turned out that this device is extremely inaccurate, and it gave me extremely wrong readings. I am not kidding. One of my suitcases was weighted 80lbs at the counter, when this device gave me 69lbs. So, this stupid device turned out costing me a total fee of $200.00. $100 for each suitcase. Avoid this if you can. Edit: The seller issued a refund on April 29th 2019.
customer_reviews.author: Rafael

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: First, I have to remove the battery to turn it off, second, the on/off button is a piece of rubber that squishes into the handle itself when you switch modes [or try to turn it off which it will not do], and then, I have to pick it out of the handle and realign it so it clicks. Given the haphazard quality, I am hesitant to give an opinion as to whether the scale is accurate or not.
customer_reviews.author: Kim W.

customer_reviews.title: Very accurate, perfect for constant travelers
customer_reviews.text: We use this in every trip to avoid paying for extra weight as we travel internationally quite often. I have tested in several ways and also always note the weigh number in the airport. Afer several trips, I can say that the accuracy of it is right within 2 lbs. I have it for almost two years and still using the same batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Cass YoungTop Contributor: Gardening

customer_reviews.title: Both scale and thermometer read incorrect
customer_reviews.text: I weighed a 5lb hand weight about 10 times and every time the weight read 5.9lbs - 6.2lbs. (Taring and replacing the battery did not produce any noticeable difference. Temperature reads as 71F yet room thermometer reads as 67F. Not sure if I just got a buggy one but I can't rely upon it.
customer_reviews.author: Sydney

customer_reviews.title: Received a dud? Scale is not accurate.
customer_reviews.text: I have come back from traveling overseas and had a bad experience at the airport. At the airport counter, we were told to remove some stuffs from the suitcases as it was more than 23kg/50lbs. We weighed it a few times at home to make sure something like this won't happen so we were shocked. Having to open up the suitcases and moving stuff out at the airport was not a pleasant experience. We purchased this item fully here on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: chuutoro

customer_reviews.title: Inaccurate, don’t buy this!
customer_reviews.text: This is highly inaccurate! I packed my bags until I was 2kgs under the limit, the next day I checked, I was 1kg over the limit, so I moved stuff around until I was 2kgs under again. Then at the airport, I was 5kgs over the limit? So unless you can afford +-10kgs leeway (which I’m guessing you don’t as you are considering buying this) it is a complete piece of garbage.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Great scale - very accurate
customer_reviews.text: Super accurate and easy to use. I use them for work where I have to pack equipment in my bad. When I use these I can pack my bag to 49.9 lbs. it’s always satisfying to hear “your bag is over weight ma’am” from the guy checking my suitcase just to have it weigh in just under the mark when he actually puts it on the scale. It matches this scale every time.
customer_reviews.author: diane

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made part
customer_reviews.text: It does work so I can’t compalin about that used it twice , but it’s hard to use . I use it for my suitcases when travel to ensure I’m not over weight but the part to hook the suitcase on is weak and flimsy and needs to be of better quality ... it kept dropping off the suitcase and cud not grasp it properly so it was annoying to keep trying over and over and lifting over and over I’m a small girl!
customer_reviews.author: C Williams

customer_reviews.title: Bought this over a month ago, and when I actually needed it, it didn't work.
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I have used a normal scale to weigh our bags before our trip to Italy. We took this to Italy and were going to use it to see how much more weight we could add to our carry ons before our flight home, but unfortunately it didn't work right out of the box. I guess I should've tested it before we ever left the states and should have read the reviews. If you buy this, test it before you can't return it.
customer_reviews.author: Bubbo Ross

customer_reviews.title: Dosen't Work - Not Accurate - Not even Close
customer_reviews.text: A scale has ONE purpose to accurately weigh an item. This poorly made piece of.....electronics.... does not DO that. It is not even close. I weighed my suitcase at home and was told by this alleged "scale" that it was 20 pounds. The same suitcase weighed in at 14 pounds at the airport! I do NOT recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Brown

customer_reviews.title: The metal triangle holding the strap bent while lifting 50lb ...
customer_reviews.text: The metal triangle holding the strap bent while lifting 50lb suitcase. Would need tools to bend it back, which is a problem while traveling.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Accurate
customer_reviews.text: I weighed (pun intended) all my options and decided to scale into an additional travel item necessity, this scale. It's small, lighter than your key fob, easy to travel with and won't let you down when your luggage is being weighed before your flight. It's easy to use and can save you a bundle if you just guess what your luggage weighs and you end up being wrong. Take an extra battery for this item with you in case your battery quits working and you are in some location that doesn't carry this type of battery.
customer_reviews.author: solid

customer_reviews.title: Gotta have travel buddy
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been intrigued by this type of luggage scale for awhile, wondering if something so small can accurately weigh hefty Pullmans so big and heavy? For years, before a trip, we’ve been awkwardly climbing onto the bathroom scale while holding up large Pullmans to be sure the are under required weight limits, nearly breaking our backs in the process. The Etekcity scale is world’s easier! Since our bags pick up considerable weight with things we buy abroad, we now pack this tiny and accurate scale, too, making sure we keep each piece of large luggage at under 50 lbs. for the international trip home.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: Did the job Well
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this before our trip to Iceland and the Faroe Islands. Weight was a HUGE issue for the small commuter planes and so I packed this. It did a fine job. You just have to 'play' with it to get an accurate reading. Every time I let it 'zero' out and tested the luggage, it was very accurate. We never had to pay for extra baggage fees when we were at 49.7 lbs !!!!!! Worth the price of admission for me!!!!!! I don't know about the other features, not why I bought it and I couldn't care less. It did exactly what I wanted it to do so, 5 stars for me !
customer_reviews.author: Erik Middelhoven

customer_reviews.title: Great For Pre-Weighing Luggage
customer_reviews.text: This little luggage scale has saved me on multiple occasions from having to repack bags in the middle of the airport to avoid excessive weight charges from the airline. You just slide the strap thru the top handle of the luggage and lift and it displays the bag weight. Once I know I'm OK weight-wise for the airline I slip it into my bag so I have it to weight before my return trip. The weight has always proved to be accurate when I've gotten to the airport. I've used it a ton over the course of a few years and the batteries are just starting to wear down now. (They're replacable) Never pack a bag or travel without it!
customer_reviews.author: NernFX

customer_reviews.title: Accurate luggage scale is easy to use and easy to travel with
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I take a couple tripe per year and she's been bitten by the overweight bag fee a couple times in recent years, so this seemed like a worthy investment. It paid off immediately as we were taking an 8-day trip to France and were able to proactively balance between checked and carry on bags. This doesn't take up much room, so it was easy to pack and use for the return trip. If you can lift the required weight and hold it reasonably steady, this is a good solution for weighing luggage.
customer_reviews.author: T. Gaydos

customer_reviews.title: Handy device - would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Four out of five stars - promo indicates can hold Tare weight - instructions don't say how. However, I may just not understand - I works great otherwise. There is just one minor glitch - the window for the display cuts off the top or bottom of the digits, depending on the angle of the light - for example, 77 can look like 11 because of the shadow cast by the window frame. You have to tilt the device back and forth to be sure you have read it correctly. Device came with an invitation to join a news letter - also has a customer service number and email address should there be a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Gabby_Jim_41

customer_reviews.title: Great Scale especially for the Price.
customer_reviews.text: It works. Its light. its attractive. Carried it with us internationally. Fit into a small pocket in the backpack. The digital aspect of it makes it far better than the others that we've tried and it was a better build than others that we have had. If there is only two issues which were minor - if they designed the main casing to be slightly wider/longer it would make the scale far easier to hold up/lift up especially with heavier bags. The rubber buttons would occasionally get stuck. The design could be slightly better in these ways but for the price and compared to the others we have tried, its a hands down winner and would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: RCSNYC2020

customer_reviews.title: Batteries constantly dies
customer_reviews.text: The concept for this device makes sense and I bought it because of the good reviews. However, I have used this device only 3 times and have had to replace the battery twice (I've only owned it for 6 months). It's crazy to think that it goes through that much battery when the same CR2032 battery can last my calculators with moderate use 3-5 years. I guess I could take the battery out each time but then that becomes inconvenient and I'd be likely to lose the battery when I needed it. I'd suggest just avoiding this brand altogether.
customer_reviews.author: marcus

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate
customer_reviews.text: The unit I received was consistently underweight by 0.3 lbs. I am frequently within that range of the weight limit and there is no way to re-calibrate this scale. I could just keep adding the additional weight but I would probably forget and run overweight. Returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Med Guru

customer_reviews.title: Expected a bit more form all the reviews
customer_reviews.text: Used this very recently when I checked in for my flight I ask what it weighs she said 28 lbs when I got home I weigh ed it again and the button you push to turn on sunk into the space I had to find something small enough to pull it back out then try again to weigh the luggage the the luggage weighed 24 lbs. I was very disappointed I may be traveling to Europe and I need a weight that is 100% accurate it was also a much different concept for attaching the weight to the luggage I wonder if that could have made the difference? Disappointed that this could be an issue at the airport.
customer_reviews.author: Kyhill/J

customer_reviews.title: Great Luggage Scale
customer_reviews.text: This is a must for anyone who flies today and does not want to worry about getting to the airport only to find out their luggage is overweight. I take this with us everywhere we travel and always weigh our luggage before leaving for the airport so we have so surprises. It is lightweight and easy to put in our carry-on luggage. I also have found it very accurate (probably within a few ounces of the weight the airline has on their scales. I highly recommend this product. I hope this review is helpful. If so, please notate that the review was helpful.
customer_reviews.author: kc

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and Compact!
customer_reviews.text: This one is my go-to scale when traveling. It's compact, accurate and hasn't failed on me yet. Some added features like LED back-lighting and more measurements would be nice though. This one comes with just two measurement types: lb and kg. It also has a thermometer which is pretty useless in my opinion. I rather have more measurement types. My favorite thing about this scale is definitely the feel of it. It feels sturdy and has anti-slip grips on the bottom unlike other scales. I definitely recommend this scale if you're traveling! Accuracy 5/5 ***** Easy to use 5/5 ***** For traveling 5/5 ***** My recommendation 5/5 *****
customer_reviews.author: Vuong Ly

customer_reviews.title: Never know what I was missing
customer_reviews.text: Shortly after buying this, I booked a flight to as destination for my first desert mountain hike. Never having done this before, and being raised a boy scout, I naturally over packed. This device made distributing my gear to not pay for overweight luggage easy. And with it's low profile, it packed well so I could do the same for my return flight. Since that trip I have learned to joy of traveling with my weighted blanket. At 20lbs, it can easily tilt the airport scales, so now what was once a convenience item in my eyes is a must have.
customer_reviews.author: Tony G

customer_reviews.title: Saved me so much money!
customer_reviews.text: On my first 2 international trips I over estimated how much my luggage weighed and ended up paying sooooo much money in weight fees. Now I travel with this (which is quite lightweight itself) and I weight my luggage before I head to the airport. I'll move things around to make sure that the weight is distributed such that I won't get charged and then before I get on the plane I reorganize if I need to to have the things I want in my backpack verses my carry on luggage. GREAT PURCHASE! I bought one for my best friend too!
customer_reviews.author: Moj

customer_reviews.title: Great product that I trust.
customer_reviews.text: This product is easy to use. I only used this so far to gauge both lbs and kg. It is pretty accurate, but if you don't trust it, at least it gives you a very close idea of how much you've packed. Others in our family loved this and are considering getting one for themselves. The only difficulty is you want to be able to lift your luggage and hold steady long enough to get a good reading. Since we bring a lot to our big family in Laos, lifting four suitcases at 50lbs more or less became exhausting. Overall, I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great price, very accurate.
customer_reviews.text: I'm going on a trip and just taking a backpack so keeping track of the weight is key for when I'm traveling as I'll be taking several plane trips throughout my trip. It's light, easy to use, and most importantly, accurate. I have hand weights and I weighed each one all the way up to fifty pounds and it was a 100% accurate. I like the added temperature feature as well as its versatility. I can use it outside of my trip, which makes it more useful, and I always appreciate that. It'll easily fit into my luggage with no hassle and will be very helpful for me and my travel companions, for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Supercalifragilisticexpialidocious

customer_reviews.title: Eliminates baggage weight concerns.  Every traveler needs one.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little scale. I go to the UK every couple of years and It gives me peace of mind knowing my bag is not overweight when I travel. I take it with me since it weighs practically nothing and takes up no space. It helps me work out the best way to distribute the shopping I do on my trips between checked bag and carry-on for the return flights. So far I've used it for 2 trips and my daughter and her husband used it in June when they went to France for the D-Day 75th anniversary commemoration. It's a very well-traveled little thing! Get one. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: StockShowMom

customer_reviews.title: Great idea
customer_reviews.text: I originally purchased the scale some time ago and had it to the side. When my travel date approached I then opened my scale only to find the measurements were off. I am old school so I have scale in the house for weighted packages. This new concept was amazing and easier to use so I was happy about the purchase. Fast back forward, I am on youtube and google reviews regarding the glitch I experienced. Brought my concerns up to Alisa over at support and we realized I had a bad apple so she happily sent me over a new and working product. Thank you! Thank you! Thank you! Super easy to use, easy to store, easy to recommend!
customer_reviews.author: jay

customer_reviews.title: Update Review to 5 Stars
customer_reviews.text: I have updated my review to 5 stars. After I contacted Etekcity, they immediately sent me a new scale and this one is accurate. Etekcity has excellent customer service and I also now have a great accurate scale! Old Review Below: Tested this with many items with known weights and it consistently weighs items 3.5% light so it is not very accurate. I don't see any way to calibrate this unfortunately. Hopefully if you buy an Etekcity Digital Hanging Luggage Scale you will be lucky and get one that is accurate. I really like the scale otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: David B.

customer_reviews.title: A real lifesaver.
customer_reviews.text: Took this on multiple overseas trips in the first two months. I cant believe I used to hold my bags and weigh myself and the bag on scales - and then subtract my weight. It was so time consuming, especially when we were either close to the limit or over. This small device literally saved us hours of frustration and possible unpacking at the airport check-in line. We couldn't live without this item now. We bought another one as a backup. Wouldn't hesitate to buy this exact item again.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: Perfect & Easy to Use!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use on a 2-week overseas trip where I knew I'd be purchasing souvenirs. There were strict luggage weight limits coming and going, of course - and they varied from flight to flight. The weight limits also pertained to carry-ons. While our group leaders had one of these portable scales to check weights of all of the bags (there were more than 40 on the trip), I appreciated having one of these myself - easy peasy! Much better than guessing and/or putting the suitcase on an old fashioned scale at home! Don't hesitate - get this scale and take it with you on your trip!
customer_reviews.author: Janice MB

customer_reviews.title: Perfect luggage scale if you travel frequently
customer_reviews.text: I travel a lot with my wife who always packs her bags to the brim. This helps us stay right at the weight so we avoid those ridiculous hundred plus fees for being half a pound over at check in. It is really accurate and easy to throw in your backpack or carry on after using. We pack to 70 lbs for international and the scale is accurate on our bags with that weight. Would definitely recommend this product to anyone travelling frequently with a lot of luggage.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony T.

customer_reviews.title: So happy I bought this.
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: It’s been 18 mo and the battery is still holding strong because I store it with the plastic piece between. Very pleased with this purchase, Why I have never gotten one of these things before, I’ll never understand. This was the best “trip” purchase I made. Was absolutely accurate. I don’t think it varies by 1/2 lb from the airline. Other posts talked about the battery draining quickly so I saved the little piece of plastic that comes in between the battery and connection point. When I was done, I simply put it back in between and tucked into my carry on. Repeated the process when returning home 3 weeks later. No battery loss.
customer_reviews.author: ADF

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I am an over-packer and therefore I have always struggled to get an accurate read of the weight of my luggage from my bathroom scale, believe me it isn't an easy task! I have even had to rearrange items in my bags at the airport to keep from paying extra because my bag was overweight. I finally got this luggage scale and it works great, it even helped me realize I didn't need a lot of the items I was cramming in my luggage. And you just throw it in your luggage and take it with you. Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: D. Denise

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: We had to travel internationally a few months ago and with the baggage restrictions and with so many family members we had to keep track of how much each bag or suitcase weighed. This was perfect and we were able to take it with us so every time we were flying international or domestic we were able to keep track of the weight issues and did not have to pay fines or be surprised at the check in desk. It's a great thing to have if you travel frequently
customer_reviews.author: Vanna

customer_reviews.title: Small, light, very useful, and better than repacking at check-in
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one we have purchases. The first one still works, but we don't always travel together! This unit is small, easy to read (yes, eyes are past 45) and I've not seen it disagree with the baggage check scale. Forget the guessing and put one of these in your backpack, purse, fanny pack, whatever. So much better than joining the folks on the floor scrambling to repack the chocolates and underwear in front of "check-in" and the ever-watching queue of fellow travelers that they are holding up. [photo credit pierreblurr (dot) wordpress (dot) com]
customer_reviews.author: Tech Dad and the Kitchen Fairy

customer_reviews.title: major headache resolved before the airport
customer_reviews.text: international airlines are more strict than national USA airline weights of baggage. Carryon luggage for international flights can weigh a total of 8 kilos (17.64 lbs). Personal is stated to be restricted to 2 kilos. My carryon was weighed and because of this scale was allowed. Our checked baggage was also weighed and within the limit based on the use of this device. It was very helpful to have in our planning of how we would allocate weight to each piece of baggage. Get one so you can sleep at night! My husband adds that use of this scale keeps him from having to step on a scale with baggage and then subtracting his weight. He likes that.
customer_reviews.author: ncd0531

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use-Accurate
customer_reviews.text: This scale is very easy to use, it has 2 options for weight-lbs and Kg which come handy for Domestic and International travel. It's very accurate, never had a problem at the airport. I usually carry it with me to destination to weigh luggage when coming back. The temperature portion works accurate too. The only problem is that due to its straight shape sometimes it hurts the hand. It would have been better if it was ergonomically shaped.
customer_reviews.author: Garima Anand

customer_reviews.title: BUY YOU ONE OF THESE !
customer_reviews.text: This thing is a life safer. I never even knew you could purchase such a thing until my sons school trip to london and his teacher whpped one out. My husband and I are both snazzy dressers and very particular about what we wear. We absolutely hate wearing the same things too often so when we fly, we would have over weight luggage about 90% of the time and would have to stand at bag check and rearrange things a few times. Or we would be running late for our flight and would just pay the extra fee. But now with this little gem we no longer have that problem. At Southwest our bags "REALLY DO FLY FREE" For-real now!
customer_reviews.author: Marcus & Marquita Holmes

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Just select the preferred unit of measure and you're on your way. You can weigh many things and with the tare feature, you can deduct the weight of a container. For example, you can weigh a bag by itself and then you will know the weight of the contents that you add to it by zeroing it out and then adding whatever you want to weigh. I highly recommend this for any traveler. The obvious use is to make sure your suitcase is under 50 pounds,
customer_reviews.author: San Diego Reviewr

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for traveling!
customer_reviews.text: This is absolutely a must have for travelers! I travel a lot for my job and I’ve had to find something that will combat the pesky overweight baggage fees. This has been the answer to my problems! I would always recommend going a few pounds lighter than what it says with my first use with it I remember I went exactly by the 49 pounds and my bag was 51 when it was weighed. I had to take a few things out just to make it less than 50.
customer_reviews.author: Reads a lot of books

customer_reviews.title: Great gadget that takes guessing out of bag weight
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome gadget that takes the guessing out of how much you bag weighs. Traveling: We use it to check our bags before going to the airport So that we are not those people that have open up their suitcase In front of God and country to deal with excess weight. Hiking: More often that that, though, we use it to weigh our backpacks before going hiking in the woods. Really helps to keep pack weight down as those extra things you throw in to the bag add up to more weight than you would think!
customer_reviews.author: BSAdad

customer_reviews.title: Very close to accurate
customer_reviews.text: Very close to accurate. My wife and I are going on an international flight and we wanted to be under 50 pounds for each of our bags. We weighed our bags with this scale it showed 48.5 pounds for each bag. When we got to the airport the one bag was 51 pounds which would’ve cost us $100 for the bag instead of the normal $30. We were able to switch some items around and both items came in under 50 pounds. I think this is a good device and it could’ve been my error in how I lifted the bags to weigh them. I will continue to use this device.
customer_reviews.author: Easy Ed

customer_reviews.title: Useful and easy to use, weight more than once to be sure about the weight.
customer_reviews.text: I was using the etekcity for my baggage because I wanted to be sure about the weight because the airlines are si strict about it. I used it and it was working well, but once, it gets a little bit miscalibrated, I turned off and then, I turned on again, and it was good again. So, if you need to be sure about the weight, I recommend to weight your baggage more than one and try to compare the result. But in general I really like it. I think it could be useful for all my trips.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Alberto

customer_reviews.title: Best if it had a wider cord & brighter display.
customer_reviews.text: 4.5 stars. Wish there was a wider cord for attaching to luggage. The one on this one doesn't feel as sturdy as I'd like. Also, in the wrong lighting, the display seemed dim. Since I was concentrating on not dropping the suitcase from the attachment cord, I had to crane a little to read display. The measurements were decent. I tested with a baby car seat that I know weighs 7.6lbs and this read 7.3 so that's pretty close. The real test will be against the airline's scale - which you have to just trust, right? Nice that this came with a battery. Great for price and I'd recommend to friends.
customer_reviews.author: TM Conway

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely hate finding out when I get to the desk at the airport that my bag is overweight. And it's often pretty close because of all the accoutrements my wife likes to take with her on trips. And stepping up on a scale with the bag is really just kind of annoying.So having this and being able to hold it on one hand really made the whole thing much easier. The readout is an easy to read location, and it seemed pretty accurate, so we'll be using it on all of our trips for the foreseeable future
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Get for travelers
customer_reviews.text: Nothing is worse that getting to the airport and finding out your luggage is over the weight limit and you have to either pay $50+ more, or go thru the trouble of trying to stuff everything into your carry on. This scale is very light and only has the necessary parts to make it a functioning scale, which is great if you want to take it with you overseas so you can check the weight of your checked bags of souvenirs.
customer_reviews.author: J & R

customer_reviews.title: Great product for a trip!
customer_reviews.text: When we weight the luggage it slightly vary with the airport scale, fortunately we give a error margin and we could reach the exact weight an the airport, though we avoid extra charges, so it is not a complain, actually the product makes me smile at the airport. We use it many times with 6 different suitcases.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Araya

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product for measuring weight & traveling.
customer_reviews.text: I got this twice already it's works perfectly and meets my needs. I use it often when I'm traveling on my flights as I don't want to pay over weight charge on the flight. It's accurate and hasn't failed me yet to this day. You really couldn't go wrong with this purchase and the seller is also wonderful available to help if something goes wrong. It's simple to understand and use. Simple two buttons one is to just turn the device on and off and the second button is to change the unit of measure for the weight which is LB and Kilogram and one oddly for temperature which I don't mind
customer_reviews.author: Rahid F Uddin

customer_reviews.title: Best scale for the price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this since whenever we travel overseas it becomes a tasker to weigh our baggage using a regular scale and trying to actually see the weight of our luggage. This has made it easier to weigh it, then you can actually get the weight since it will lock into the weight of your luggage. And its small enough to bring with you on your travels. This also pulls double duty weighing my bicycles!!!! Not willing to pay for a bike scale that costs $60 and cant even bring it with you for travel. This scale for the price is a no brainer. It can do more.... just use your own ingenuity.
customer_reviews.author: Ramir

customer_reviews.title: What a great device for traveling
customer_reviews.text: I got this for a trip to Disney and it worked great. It is small and does not take up a lot of space. I am 66 and was able to pick up my suitcase with the device. It saved me from a overweight charge. My device register at 49.8 lbs and at bag check in it weight at 49.9. I think that was excellent value and a great tool to have on my trip. I plan to take it with me every time I travel.
customer_reviews.author: AJK

customer_reviews.title: Life saver at the airport
customer_reviews.text: This little gadget was awesome for traveling. We recently took a 7-day cruise, and we decided to fly instead of drive. I had to pack enough clothes, swimsuits, and gym clothes for 7 days, plus all my shoes, makeup bags, and workout equipment. Since I was packing weighted vest and hand weights, I was nervous that my luggage would exceed the airport weight restrictions. With this luggage scale, however, I was able to strategically divide up my luggage so that both my suitcases were within the weight restrictions. It allows you to change between units (lb vs. kg), and it also shows you the temperature. Pretty cool. And it's really small so it fits easily in your luggage.
customer_reviews.author: Ashes

customer_reviews.title: Quick and Easy
customer_reviews.text: This was a second purchase. I have another of the same model in a second home. No more grabbing the suitcase and standing on a bathroom scale, trying to see the reading and then doing the math to get the actual luggage weight. This scale attaches easily and gives both metric and non-metric weights. The value is easily visible and remains on screen after you set the luggage down. I can say I would buy it again as I have already purchased two. :o)
customer_reviews.author: pmthomas

customer_reviews.title: Great Handy Device
customer_reviews.text: Not only does this little device measure the weight of your luggage, but it gives you peace of mind that you won't end up being charged more because your bag is over weight. I purchased this because a friend of mine had one on my last trip. I was told that you get 50 pounds for your first piece of shipped luggage, and if you are over, you get charged a lot of money. I measured my bag with my friends device and it showed 48 pounds. It was the same weight as their scale and I wasn't charged extra. This is a great little device.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. G

customer_reviews.title: Handy travel luggage scale.
customer_reviews.text: The weight that came up usually differed from the weight on the airline scale but it always matches my bathroom scale weight. It does require you to lift the luggage to weigh it while holding the handle of the device. Can be a bit awkward to do. The scale does measure in pounds or kilograms. Easy to switch over to the system you want to use. On occasion it seemed to make the switch on its own. It did come in handy when we were close to the airline weight limit after purchasing items while on the road.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Stasio

customer_reviews.title: Very portable and handy
customer_reviews.text: This product is great for travellers who have a lot of luggage. I was a college student until not too long ago and this would've been super useful to have during then. I still travel a decent amount and this has come into use multiple times. It's much easier than trying to weigh myself then weigh myself holding a 50 pound suitcase to see if it exeeds the limit or not. It's also accurate. I tried using this then using my normal scale at home and the weight of the suitcase was the same using both devices. Would highly reccomend for people who travel with big bags a lot!
customer_reviews.author: bchong

customer_reviews.title: Weight accuracy pretty right on!
customer_reviews.text: Works as described! It was practically right on and will not travel without it when I have the possibility of checking a bag in. I just slip this into my carry on or tote. No more wondering and guessing how much my bag weighs! It’s small and feels pretty sturdy. I like how it’s a strap with a hook versus the others just have a hook. I also like that you can change the unit measurement no matter where you’re traveling to. Bonus: it even tells you the temperature.
customer_reviews.author: CarinnMay

customer_reviews.title: Works great - Even at low weights
customer_reviews.text: I tested mine using a 1.7kG bag of walnuts, works perfectly. Glad I purchased was nearly put off by another Reviewer who said it didn't work at low weights. All I know is mine works great,, highly recommend !
customer_reviews.author: Stephen W. Smith

customer_reviews.title: This thing is great!
customer_reviews.text: I was a little hesitant to buy this since I already have a bag for my Mavic 2 Pro that came with the Fly More Combo. I'm not a fan of that bag so I decided to look around. I was shopping for a few other after-market Mavic stuff and this one popped up. I used it for the first time yesterday and love it. Everything fits! The drone goes in much easier than the DJI bag and the case feels solid. It takes up more space than the other bag, but it's definitely worth it. I can fit all of my Polar Pro filters, chargers, extra batteries, extra props, landing gear, etc. I'd buy it again in a heartbeat!
customer_reviews.author: Prime Member

customer_reviews.title: Convenient and Easy
customer_reviews.text: Good travel aide, small, easy to use and read, very good easy to use strap for lifting luggage and getting weight. Excellent for me as I do lots of foreign travel with varying airline weight limits. Scale shuts off automatically after 2 minutes, but if you want to weigh more than one item, you need to manually shut it down (just hold on/off button) as it will retain weight of first item until cleared. I will keep it in my empty luggage so I have it when I need it. I would buy it again in a moment. Not sure about longevity of unit as I just got it recently.
customer_reviews.author: Emil

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this in time for our family vacation and it worked like a charm. We used this scale to balance all of our luggage to ensure they were all under the maximum allowed weight. When we got to the airport - check-in was a breeze as all of our luggage was under weight. Thank you for making a great and affordable scale.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Spot on accurate!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, compact and accurate. Well made. Durable. I can't pack light no matter how hard I try! With the help of this scale, I was able to pare down my bag to a weight of 39lbs before I left the house....just under my 40lb limit. And sure enough that's what it weighed when I checked it! It was spot on accurate! So glad I purchased this. It pays for itself in what I would be charged for over the limit baggage fees and/or the headache of having to open my checked bag to remove the excess weight at the airport. Excellent purchase!
customer_reviews.author: tra71RN

customer_reviews.title: Not bad at all!!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use ,, takes about 3 -4 times to really get the hang of how to use this !! Accuracy is how to find a hanger high enough to get a reading, while not hitting any walls,,, Doubling the suit case over,, or a helper can be effective. Its light weight , easy to handle,, perfect size , balance,.,read outs are accurate,,, lbs,, or kilo's battery driven ,,, great product.
customer_reviews.author: Geezers R Us!

customer_reviews.title: very convenient, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: We used this when we went over seas on vacation just recently. You literally just open the box and you can use it. No programming, guessing, or wait times. It is so easy and convenient. It saved us so much time when we were packing because we could just weigh things at the house instead of trying to go somewhere to weigh bags. It is very small and easily packed into any bag. Only reason I did not give it 5 stars is because I do not know the longevity of the item/battery since we just bought it in August '18. But, quality, durability, ease of use, etc it is an amazing product so far.
customer_reviews.author: Younes B.

customer_reviews.title: Useful and faster than a body weight scale!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased it since i'm going to Japan and flying on a budget airline, I usually weight my luggage using body scale at home, but it's not possible when i'm travelling! Here comes the $13 handheld scale that i can bring with me on my trip and allows me to measure my luggage in my hotel room and avoid getting overweight charge that cost more than this product! Well worth it! I tried the scale and measure all my bags that i'm going to bring with me and documented their weight using this scale. Super easy to use! I dont even have to read the manual!
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: easy to use, kilos or lbs, etc.
customer_reviews.text: I used this for two int'l trips recently and found it very handy to ensure my bags were within weight limits before getting to airport. This is especially helpful if you shop at your destination & the bags naturally get heavier :) I use the pounds unit of measure, but a friend travelling with me borrowed it & was happy it also uses kilos. Super easy to use. Also, my hotel room was blazing hot and the thermometer feature came in handy when I needed to confirm the temp before asking the hotel to cool it down.
customer_reviews.author: TerTer

customer_reviews.title: Must have for airline travel
customer_reviews.text: It's small but mighty. I love that it can convert between kilograms and pounds with just a touch of the button. And you can even get the temperature (either Celsius or Fahrenheit), although I am not sure why a luggage scale needs this feature. But it's a nice bonus. I've only used it to weigh our luggage for one trip but I've weighed each piece multiple times to make sure none of them go over the Aer Lingus allowance. The peace of mind is worth every penny I spent on it and it really is pretty inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: wisegolfgal

customer_reviews.title: “Must have” travelers tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool to have and although I bought it for travel and piece of mind for luggage it had come in handy. If your one of those people who pack on the border of the weight limit this small scale will put your mind at ease. You won’t have to be pulling things out of your luggage standing at the ticket counter or paying overage fees because of being over the weight limit. (Guilty). I don’t know why I didn’t have one already. If your a traveler this is a must have.
customer_reviews.author: SMH

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I’m always tinkering on “overweight” luggage at the airport. Finally bought a scale so I can make sure I don’t overload the suitcase before having to repack at the airport if my luggage is overweight. Have tested this a few times and it’s accurate compared to the airport scales!
customer_reviews.author: stefnee

customer_reviews.title: Accurate and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Bought this sweet little luggage scale for a trip to NYC in the dead of winter. Had to pack heavy coats and such and am always worried about going over the 50 piounds the airlines allow. This scale turns on with the push of a button, hooks up easily with a sturdy strap and only took about 2 seconds to lock in a weight. The weight was infact eactly whatthe airline scale said it was. It was easy to lift suitcase with 2 hands on T-shaped bar of scale. Perfect addition to travel accessories. Batteries are replaceable with coin batteries.
customer_reviews.author: slrincv

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and great for traveling
customer_reviews.text: My dad has had something similar for years because he travels often. I recently went on interrnational travel and wanted to make sure my bag was within the weight limit, especially when I was coming home with all the souvenirs! This worked awesome. It was very accurate (per the airline scale) and gave me peace of mind so I didn't have to unpack at the ticket counter like I've done in the past (much to the chagrin of all the other passengers!)
customer_reviews.author: Terp

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use and Responsive Seller
customer_reviews.text: Have had just over a year and have used the scale once or twice. Went to use again and now it doesn't work. Not a good lifespan for a lightly used product. 6/11/2019 - revised from 1 star to 4 stars due to the seller’s willingness to go the extra distance to be helpful and responsive even after the warranty period by promptly sending a replacement. This is a good product, well-designed and easy to use. I just hope the replacement will last longer than 18 months and 2-3 uses so left at four stars.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Hoem

customer_reviews.title: Love this thing!
customer_reviews.text: I just bought my second one because we misplaced the first, but I love this thing! We travel with young children and are frequently pushing the limits of checked bag weights so it is nice to know going out the door that you won't exceed the 50lb. limit. I'm now also using it for much lighter work as I'm planning to get my daughter into backpacking. It helps enormously in figuring out where her (and my) pack weight will be. I've got a lot of old camping gear and you certainly pay a premium for lightweight supplies. This helps me figure out if an upgrade to a new pack, sleeping bag, even headlamp might be worth it or not.
customer_reviews.author: LJ

customer_reviews.title: Best Tool to have when traveling with luggage
customer_reviews.text: This is a great buy. Works well every time. Bought one for my sister. Saves the trouble of repacking your baggage at the airport, knowing EXACTLY what each piece weighs so I don't exceed the weight limit (not me, the baggage, haha). It is accurate, it is easy to use. As a bonus, it also gives you the ambient temperature wherever you are. It switches between LBS and KGS easily. And resets to zero quickly. It also keeps the last reading available for you until user resets the display that's easy to read.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Wong

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate enough
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't give quite the same weight reading every time. I've noticed that it reads different weights, sometimes off by 5 pounds or more, when weighing the same bag. I've also found that mine constantly reports higher weights than reality. This is comparing to another scale I have as well as the actual weights at the airport. It's fine to know that a bag is not 50 pounds, but this scale is not good enough when you're right on the edge.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Heads-up on baggage weight
customer_reviews.text: We were planning a trip with air and cruise weight regulations so we decided to get this to know ahead of time if we would have a problem. It was much easier than weighing yourself on a scale with your bag. Easy to use and small enough to stash in a pocket of your carry on. Very much worth the cost. Handy tool now that so many travel means are checking weights carefully.
customer_reviews.author: BJE

customer_reviews.title: Study-Abroad-Tested
customer_reviews.text: I used this scale for the 5 months that I spent in France and it saved me so much stress and money simply because I traveled so much and was able to pack my suitcases to the exact weight limit and avoid all the extra fees that would have followed suit if I had been a pound/kilo over. Super lightweight and easy to use. None of the places I stayed in just casually had scales for me to use and I constantly had to check myself to make sure I wasn't accumulating to much stuff I wouldn't be able to bring back home with me. Definitely a traveling essential.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: Right on the dot
customer_reviews.text: When i weighed my items they weighed exactly the same as what the weigher at the station weighed. So this was exactly what i needed and for the price im so happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie4j20

customer_reviews.title: Needed
customer_reviews.text: Needed this for traveling. I am a compression cubes packer to get everything in one bag. Well, I push the limits often. Now that the airlines are weighing bags for trips, I have to weight it. I can use my bathroom scale at home, but SOL on the road. So, it is a necessary travel item, especially if you bring back more weight in souvenirs. Liked this brand and style the best.
customer_reviews.author: Christy P.

customer_reviews.title: Very helpful!
customer_reviews.text: I read some other reviews saying the scale was off by a pound or two, so I kept that in my and made it a goal to have my bag weigh a max of 48 lbs. At home my bag weighed between 48-49 lbs (it didn’t stay steady at a number, but did not hit 50). Once at the airport, it weighed 50 lbs exactly, which is what I was hoping for! This scale is a great way to prepare and prevent bag overage fees as long as you keep it below 50! :)
customer_reviews.author: Lin

customer_reviews.title: Very practical
customer_reviews.text: I love this scale because it is easy to pack. I compared the weight of my luggage with the big one I have at home because I know that one is the same as the airport scale and this one was off by 2 pounds, so I only had to make sure I left my luggage 2 pounds lighter, but I guess that depends on the airport you're flying from. I used it through my Europe trip and had no issues with it.
customer_reviews.author: BlueMoon

customer_reviews.title: Travel buddy
customer_reviews.text: For the price we paid I honestly was expecting something that was a little cheap and not really accurate. I was surprised on all counts. Quality of construction and accuracy is very good. So useful in weighing your bags before that trip to the airport and hearing that your bags are overweight....again. We travel quite a bit and this has become part of our travel kit. Had this now for a while and it’s holding up very well. Very useful also just for weighing “stuff”
customer_reviews.author: Mark Thorn

customer_reviews.title: More uses than just luggage
customer_reviews.text: This is a handy, reliable and sturdy luggage scale. It is designed to be ergonomically used with one hand, and although it can read up to 110 lbs, the practical limit (when holding with the fingers on one hand) is probably closer to 50 lbs. It works well with luggage and the strap/hook design without fear of the luggage coming loose and dropping on the ground. Because of the 0.1 lb incremental scale on the readout, I also found this handy for weighing guitars (this is a factor that people consider when purchasing the instruments).
customer_reviews.author: J. Clark

customer_reviews.title: very acurate, light, easy to use, convienet, fits in your suitcase
customer_reviews.text: this is great I travel a lot and use it all the time it is a lifesaver especially when you travel internationally and have a weight limit and of course you buy things going from country to country I am able to keep track of how much weight I have. It is extremely accurate every time I have weighed it and then gone to the airport it was either been the same or within a couple .00 of what it weighs in there at. It is also very light and easy to use as well as small and compact so it fits anywhere and doesn't take up much weight at all.
customer_reviews.author: Arija

customer_reviews.title: Works. Well.
customer_reviews.text: Having a portable scale like this has been really helpful. Can't tell if I still have propane left for the BBQ? Weight it! (Obviously) Not sure if the luggage will go? Weigh it. This scale is a really compact form factor. It's obviously not accurate down to the ounce. For that you should get a food scale. But for weighing stuff in pounds, it's fine. And the strap as a way of connecting to whatever you're weighing works great.
customer_reviews.author: The Lin Family

customer_reviews.title: Accurate to within a 1/10 of an ounce on the airport scale.
customer_reviews.text: Was hesitant to buy this product because of the complaints of shoddy product, rapidly drained batteries and easy breakage during use. Because of this I purchased two scales. Happy to report those negative responses were not what I experienced. Removed all worry if my bags were over weight. Would buy this again!
customer_reviews.author: shineyboot

customer_reviews.title: This makes sense
customer_reviews.text: I've always wanted a luggage scale. I've been trying to weigh everything on my innaccurate bathroom scale for years. This device weighs in kg or pounds and gives the temperature too. The numbers are a little hard to see (for my old eyes). I need extra light to read it accurately. This is easy to use and small enough to slip into your luggage without a concern. It's very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: MJC

customer_reviews.title: Great, accurate!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a 3 week vacation so I could make sure I wouldn't be charged overweight fees at the airport on the trip home. This is so easy to use! Weighs in both lbs and kilograms. Also reads you temperature, but I don't think I'd ever use that function on this particular unit. I was skeptical of this thing at first, but after this trip, it's proved it's worth.
customer_reviews.author: Pengy

customer_reviews.title: Great Way to Weigh!
customer_reviews.text: Needed this to be certain of our carry on weight for ALITALIA. They are super strict at 17 lbs. We put a fresh battery in our bath scale. My husband got on. We took the weight. I then handed him the suitcase and he weighed again. There was a 14.6 lb difference. We then used the Etekcity scale and weighed the suitcase. Guess what..14.6 lbs. Right on the money. Easy to use. A good investment for future travel I
customer_reviews.author: Suitcaseannie

customer_reviews.title: Simple, light, and accurate
customer_reviews.text: Bought this with some skepticism because of the varying reviews but it was a lifesaver for recent cross country trips for Christmas. It was within .1 pounds of the airport scales for the 4 pieces of luggage we used. The strap you wrap around the luggage handles works well and the buttons to use it are simple. The power button resets the scale back to zero in between weighs. As it states there is also a thermometer (not sure why) but that seems to be accurate too if you ever have need to use it.
customer_reviews.author: jman

customer_reviews.title: OK for 30 days
customer_reviews.text: The scale seemed ideal at first. Used it twice and then it read "low battery" and wouldn't work. It was odd because I had gotten it just a month before. Obviously a faulty battery, but after replacing it TWICE, it still didn't work. No problem, I'll return it. Didn't notice that it had a 30 day warranty, which I missed by a week. Me thinks there might be a reason for the 30 day warranty. Edit; After complaining the company sent me a replacement that has worked fine. Good customer service!
customer_reviews.author: Ken S

customer_reviews.title: Accurate compared to scale at airline checkin
customer_reviews.text: Really helpful to check the weight of our checked bags while we are still packing so we can rearrange what goes into various bags or even skip packing some items if the bags get close to being overweight. Finding out you missed the weight limit by 2 lbs at the airport and getting slapped with a hefty overweight bag fee would really irritate me at the start of a trip. We find this scale particularly helpful when packing scuba gear and golf bags to know if we have extra weight flexibility for optional items like extra sunscreen and optional/duplicates gear.
customer_reviews.author: M Sheridan

customer_reviews.title: Bags weighed at home w this device weighed the same on the airport scales
customer_reviews.text: I used to be a horrible overpacker. Now that I have this gadget I am ten pounds under every time I pack. I didn't have any idea how much stuff weighed. Now I have a new understanding of weight and packing for a trip. Other than revolutionizing my life since I'm in the air traveling so much, it will keep you under the weight limit so you don't have to pay a heavy bag fee. It will save you a lot of money. It is durable and reliable. Bags weighed at home weighed the same at the airport.
customer_reviews.author: BottleTree Farm

customer_reviews.title: Easiest way to weigh luggage!
customer_reviews.text: Love our new Luggage hand held digital scale. We are planning a trip soon and last year our scale was way off! So we will be better prepared before heading to the airport this time! No more worries with over weight luggage. This unit has a nylon strap you wrap around the handle to lift. Turn power button on lift when weight blinks it’s set to that weight. Set it down and remove then turn power off.
customer_reviews.author: Heaven Bound

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use scale
customer_reviews.text: Well priced, easy to operate scale. All one needs to do is turn on the power button, wrap the strap around a luggage handle, and lift. The scale is easy to read, and very accurate as I tested it by weighing a 30 pound dumbbell. The scale can be switched between pounds and kilograms, which is a very nice feature.
customer_reviews.author: D.E.
